content: holly s mandala beanie materials double knit 8ply yarn of your choice this is a great opportunity to use yarn from your stash you can use as many or as few colours as you wish 4mm crochet hook sewing needle for working in the ends abbreviations chain chain cluster yo and insert hook into the next st yo and pull up a loop yo and insert hook into the same stitch and pull through 2 loops two times when you have completed all 3 dcs in this way you should have 4 loops on your hook yo and pull through all 4 loops double_crochet double_crochet puff yo insert hook in stitch yo pull loop through st and make a loop the same height as previous sts in the working row three times yo pull through all 7 loops on hoop ch1 single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch space -space st/sts stitch/stitches yo yarn over this beanie fits a young teen but can be adjusted to fit a child or adult by adjusting the hook size to get started make 4ch and slip_stitch into the 1st chain to form a ring alternatively you can start with a magic ring round 1 chain 2 counts as first double_crochet make 11dc s into ring join to the top of the beginning chain-2 with a slip_stitch 12dc round 2 ch3 this counts as the first double_crochet and ch1 double_crochet into the next st ch1 11 times join to the top of the beginning chain-2 with a sl st 12dc 12 ch1 round 3 join with a new colour in any chain-1 space make 1 cluster chain 2 in next chain-1 space 1 cluster chain 2 11 times join to the top of the first cluster with a slip_stitch 12 clusters 12 chain-2 spaces round 4 join with a new colour in any chain-2 space chain 2 counts as first double_crochet 3 double_crochet into same space in next chain-2 space 4 double_crochet 11 times join to the top of the beginning chain-2 with a sl st 48dc round 5 join with a new colour in any double_crochet ch2 this counts as the first double_crochet double_crochet into each st join to the top of the beginning chain-2 with a slip_stitch 48 double_crochet round 6 join with a new colour in any double_crochet 1 puff ch1 remember the completion of a puff stitch is ch1 therefore you are effectively working chain 2 skip the next st and work 1 puff stitch into the next stitch chain 1 23 times join to the top of the beginning puff with a slip_stitch 24 puff stitches 24 chain-2 spaces round 7 join with a new colour in any chain-2 space ch2 this counts as the first double_crochet 2dc in the same space 3dc into the next chain-2 space 23 times join to the top of the beginning chain-2 with a slip_stitch 72 double_crochet round 8 join with a new colour in any double_crochet ch1 this does not count as a st 1
